Fact: Joan of Arc was born in 1412 in Domremy, France.
At the age of 13, Joan heard voices claiming to be from Saints Michael, Margaret, and Catherine.
In 1429, at the age of 17, Joan successfully lead a French army to victory at Orleans.
In 1430, Joan was captured by the Burgundians and sold to the English.
In May 1431, Joan was tried by an English court and found guilty of heresy.
In May 1431, Joan was burned at the stake in Rouen, France.
In 1920, Joan of Arc was canonized as a Catholic saint.
